blogPosts.title: The Great Coffee Heist of 2024
blogPosts.content: It all started on a Monday morning when someone noticed the premium coffee beans had mysteriously relocated to the executive lounge. Our mission: retrieve them before the afternoon slump hits. Operation Java Freedom was a success, with minimal casualties (one spilled latte).
blogPosts.author: Alice Chen

blogPosts.title: Mission Impossible: The Stapler Redistribution
blogPosts.content: Dave from accounting hoarded 15 staplers in his desk drawer. We organized a covert operation to redistribute them across the office. The mission was completed in under 10 minutes, and Dave still hasn't noticed. Code name: Operation Red Swingline.
blogPosts.author: Marcus Johnson

blogPosts.title: How We Turned the Conference Room Into a Blanket Fort
blogPosts.content: Last Friday at 4 PM, we executed our most ambitious heist yet. Using 20 blankets, 15 chairs, and pure determination, we transformed Conference Room B into an epic blanket fort. The meeting scheduled for 5 PM was... interesting.
blogPosts.author: Sarah Park

blogPosts.title: The Mystery of the Missing Lunch Labels
blogPosts.content: Someone's been peeling off lunch labels in the break room fridge. We set up a sting operation with a decoy sandwich labeled 'Property of Tony.' The culprit? The office cat. Mission status: Partially successful.
blogPosts.author: Tony Ramirez

blogPosts.title: Operation Desk Swap: A Tale of Confusion
blogPosts.content: While Karen was on vacation, we swapped her entire desk setup with Mike's. Everything. Down to the family photos in different frames. She came back today. The confusion was glorious. Mike is still finding her sticky notes.
blogPosts.author: Mike Peters

blogPosts.title: The Post-It Note Takeover
blogPosts.content: Using exactly 2,847 post-it notes, we covered every visible surface of Brad's cubicle. His monitor, keyboard, phone, even his coffee mug. It took him 2 hours to find his mouse. Worth every minute of planning.
blogPosts.author: Jennifer Wu

blogPosts.title: Heist Fail: The Printer Rebellion
blogPosts.content: We tried to relocate the noisy printer to the storage closet. The printer had other plans. It jammed, beeped loudly, and printed 47 blank pages. We aborted the mission. The printer won this round.
blogPosts.author: Alex Kim

blogPosts.title: Mission: Replace All Desktop Backgrounds with Cats
blogPosts.content: During the holiday party, we changed every unlocked computer's desktop background to different cat photos. 23 computers, 23 cats. The IT department was not amused. We were very amused.
blogPosts.author: Rachel Martinez

blogPosts.title: The Great Snack Drawer Investigation
blogPosts.content: Someone raided the communal snack drawer three times this week. We set up a surveillance operation using the security camera footage. Plot twist: it was the CEO. Mission accomplished but we can't report it.
blogPosts.author: David Lin

blogPosts.title: How We Convinced Everyone It Was Hawaiian Shirt Day
blogPosts.content: By strategically wearing Hawaiian shirts and casually mentioning it to different people, we convinced 15 employees that today was Hawaiian Shirt Day. It wasn't. The looks on their faces during the 9 AM meeting were priceless.
blogPosts.author: Emily Santos

blogPosts.title: Operation Rubber Duck: A Debugging Story
blogPosts.content: We placed 50 rubber ducks throughout the dev team's area overnight. Each duck had a different programming joke attached. By noon, they were all on desks being used for actual rubber duck debugging. Success?
blogPosts.author: Chris Taylor

blogPosts.title: The Mysterious Case of the Rearranged Keyboard
blogPosts.content: Someone's been swapping random keys on the mechanical keyboards in the dev pit. We've narrowed it down to three suspects. The investigation continues. QWERTY is no longer safe.
blogPosts.author: Stephanie Brown

heists.title: Coffee Machine Relocation
heists.description: Move the fancy espresso machine from the executive floor to the common break room. Operation must be completed during lunch hour when executives are away.

heists.title: Birthday Surprise Setup
heists.description: Decorate Sarah's desk with balloons and streamers before she arrives at 9 AM. Must be done covertly between 7-8:30 AM.

heists.title: The Whiteboard Marker Mystery
heists.description: Someone keeps taking all the good whiteboard markers. Set up a sting operation to catch the culprit.

heists.title: Plant Rescue Mission
heists.description: The office plants on the 3rd floor are dying. Water them all and leave mysterious 'From your secret plant guardian' notes.

heists.title: Cable Organization Crusade
heists.description: The cable situation under Jim's desk is a disaster. Organize it while he's in his 2-hour meeting. Bonus points for color-coding.

heists.title: Motivational Quote Takeover
heists.description: Replace all the corporate motivational posters with funny ones. Make them look official enough that it takes a while to notice.

heists.title: Meeting Room Name Rebellion
heists.description: The boring meeting room names (Conference A, B, C) need to go. Create and install new nameplates with creative names like 'The Thunder Dome' and 'Decision Central'.

heists.title: Snack Drawer Restocking
heists.description: The snack drawer is always empty by Tuesday. Secretly restock it with premium snacks and see how long it takes people to notice the upgrade.

heists.title: The Great Desk Plant Swap
heists.description: Swap everyone's desk plants with each other. Try to match plant personalities with their new owners for maximum confusion.

heists.title: Mystery Compliment Campaign
heists.description: Leave anonymous, specific, genuine compliments on people's desks. Must be personalized and thoughtful, not generic.

heists.title: Custom Printer Error Messages
heists.description: Change the printer error messages to something more entertaining. 'PC LOAD LETTER' becomes 'THE PRINTER GODS DEMAND SACRIFICE'.

heists.title: The Chair Height Adjustment
heists.description: Slowly adjust someone's chair height down by 1cm each day until they notice. Document their confusion.

heists.title: Secret Keyboard Shortcut Training
heists.description: Leave helpful keyboard shortcut cheat sheets on people's desks. Make them think the IT fairy visited overnight.

heists.title: Office Scavenger Hunt Setup
heists.description: Create and hide clues for an office-wide scavenger hunt. Final prize: the good parking spot for a week.

heists.title: Ergonomic Intervention
heists.description: Notice anyone with bad posture? Leave anonymous ergonomic tips and a small plant on their desk with a note: 'Your spine will thank you'.
